title: Miroslav Kadlec
text:
Miroslav Kadlec (born 22 June 1964) is a Czech former professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>.
During his career, Kadlec played for four Czech clubs, and also had an eight-year stint with <a href="Bundesliga">Bundesliga</a>'s <a href="1.%20FC%20Kaiserslautern">1. FC Kaiserslautern</a>, where he was crowned league champion in <a href="1990%E2%80%9391%20Bundesliga">1991</a> and <a href="1997%E2%80%9398%20Bundesliga">1998</a>, the second straight out of the <a href="2.%20Bundesliga">second division</a>.
Kadlec played for <a href="Czechoslovakia%20national%20football%20team">Czechoslovakia</a> and later the <a href="Czech%20Republic%20national%20football%20team">Czech Republic</a>; for both he played a total of 64 matches and scored two goals. He took part in the <a href="1990%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1990 FIFA World Cup</a>, played the full ninety minutes in the nation's five matches. Six years later he led the <a href="Czech%20national%20football%20team">Czech national football team</a> on its way to the <a href="UEFA%20Euro%201996">1996 UEFA European Football Championship</a> silver, where he missed only one game because of a two yellow card-suspension.
His son <a href="Michal%20Kadlec">Michal</a> is also a professional footballer.
Honours.
Club.
1. FC Kaiserslautern
International.
Czech Republic
